Overview

Ireland's main state institution engaged in economic and tax topics are the Revenue Commissioners, the Department of Finance and their internal organizations. Regarding fiscalization rules, currently there are no specific laws or other regulations specifically dedicated to the topic.*

However, the way of handling transactions and issuing receipts can be concluded from the explanations provided below. Although there are no specific fiscalization requirements, Z-report is obligatory since June 2008.

Language: There are two official status languages for Ireland. There is no specific law requirement that the POS application must support Irish and, consequently, no fine or penalty defined in case it does not, but it is assumed that Irish or English should be used and is expected so. 

  • Irish 
  • English

The locale can be configured as detailed in the localization configuration guide.

Currency: The official currency of Belgium is "EURO". The official currency code (ISO currency standard) is "EUR". 

The currency denomination can be configured as detailed in the localization configuration guide.

Tax Configuration

Value Added Tax (VAT) is a tax on sales. The VAT payer, who must previously register for VAT with the Tax Administration, charges his customers a tax proportional to the price of the goods sold for the services rendered. This tax must be paid by the taxpayer to the tax authority after deduction of the VAT charged to him by his own suppliers (input tax). Natural or legal persons are subject to VAT if they independently and regularly carry out an economic activity of any kind, regardless of the purpose or the results of this activity and the place of execution. 

VAT Rates: VAT rates are categorized into buckets below. *

  • Standard/Normal tax rate 23%
  • Reduced tax rate: 13,5%
  • Second, Reduced tax rate: 9%
  • Livestock rate 4,8%
  • Flat rate additions 5,5%

VAT Tax Configuration: The information about configuring the country as VAT is detailed in the localization configuration guide.

Receipt Configuration

A receipt is a conclusive document that confirms that payment has been made for a service/goods. A generated receipt needs to include:

  • Company information
  • Date and time of issue
  • Serial number - unique and sequential
  • Cash register number
  • Store id
  • Item Price, Quantity, Description
  • Discounts or charges
  • Total amount paid including VAT
  • VAT breakdown

Additionally, best practice is also to include items. All additional information such as pictures, barcodes, QR codes, promotional messages, etc. can be included as there are no legal requirements.

Receipt Configuration: Configuring receipts specific for a country is detailed in the localization configuration guide.

Reports

Regarding reports, from July 2008 there are mandatory regulations on Z total reports. The Z total reports are summaries of certain data, and therefore they do not contain any detailed data at transaction level. The Z total reports and all data supporting the reports will need to be retained. 

FOr Z report configuration, please follow this Reporting configuration guide and enablement guide

Services

There are no specific services exposed for Belgium localization.

 

 

* The fiscal guidelines and numbers (annual turn over, tax rates) are as of Aug-2023, which might be subjected to change as per local laws.
